Detailed Description

Layout container for a view hierarchy that can be scrolled by the user, allowing it to be larger than the physical display.

A ScrollWidget can only place one child in it containing the entire contents to scroll; this child may itself be a layout manager with a complex hierarchy of objects. A child that is often used is a LinearLayout in a vertical/horizontal orientation, presenting a vertical/horizontal array of top-level items that the user can scroll through.

ScrollWidget supports vertical and horizontal both orientation scrolling. If you use a horizontal orientation scrolling, should never use with a ListView, since ListView takes care of its own scrolling.

The TextWidget class also takes care of its own scrolling, so does not require a ScrollWidget, but using the two together is possible to achieve the effect of a text view within a larger container.

The default orientation of ScrollWidget is vertical.

 LinearController* lc = new LinearController(this);
 TextWidget* tw = new TextWidget(this);
 tw->setText("Hello World");
 lc->addWidget(tw);
 ScrollWidget* sw = new ScrollWidget(this);
 sw->addWidget(lc);

bool gaia::ui::ScrollWidget::fullScroll ( int32_t  direction)

Handles scrolling in response to a "home/end" shortcut press.

This method will scroll the view to the top or bottom and give the focus to the topmost/bottommost component in the new visible area. If no component is a good candidate for focus, this scrollwidget reclaims the focus.

int32_t gaia::ui::ScrollWidget::getMaxScrollAmount ( )

Return The maximum amount this scroll widget will scroll in response to an arrow event.

bool gaia::ui::ScrollWidget::isFillViewport ( )

Indicates whether this ScrollWidget's content is stretched to fill the viewport.

bool gaia::ui::ScrollWidget::isSmoothScrollingEnabled ( )

Returns whether smooth scrolling is enable.

bool gaia::ui::ScrollWidget::pageScroll ( int32_t  direction)

Handles scrolling in response to a "page up/down" shortcut press.

This method will scroll the view by one page up or down and give the focus to the topmost/bottommost component in the new visible area. If no component is a good candidate for focus, this scrollwidget reclaims the focus.

void gaia::ui::ScrollWidget::setFillViewport ( bool  fillViewport)

Indicates this ScrollWidget whether it should stretch its content height to fill the viewport or not.

void gaia::ui::ScrollWidget::setSmoothScrollingEnabled ( bool  smoothScrollingEnabled)
